alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 21 at 3:20PM AKDT until April 24 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Windy with snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to up to 2 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause power outages in the Fairbanks area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will develop late tonight and continue into Saturday. Northeast winds gusting to 30 mph are expected to develop after midnight tonight and continue through Monday. These winds could blow down trees and cause a few power outages in the Fairbanks area. Higher terrain such as the Steese and Elliot Highway Summits could see gusts to 40 mph and reduced visibility in blowing snow. Winds are expected to decrease late Monday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
